bwwExcerpt: "Mueller shows us a reluctant star, a woman who only really starting singing out of necessity and would always have been happier with a few hit songs, a nice home and a man she really could trust. At the end of "Beautiful," she's not that different from how she is at the start. Most jukebox shows swing on that obscurity-fame-meltdown-comeback-maturity axis. "Beautiful," in its best moments, manages to suggest that the life of our artist is really just small moments that fall together, unknowingl
